articles.title: NVIDIA, Huang Win Top Honors in Innovation, Engineering
articles.summary: NVIDIA has been named the world's most innovative company by Fast Company magazine, recognizing its transformative work in putting AI to use across various industries. This accolade follows NVIDIA founder and CEO Jensen Huang's induction into the U.S. National Academy of Engineering for his contributions to high-powered graphics processing units and fueling the AI revolution. Leaders from Microsoft, Stanford University, and TSMC have praised Huang's visionary leadership and enduring impact on computing and AI.

articles.title: Blackwell: Nvidia's GPU architecture to power new generation of trillion-parameter generative AI models
articles.summary: Nvidia has unveiled its new Blackwell GPU architecture, designed to power trillion-parameter generative AI models with significantly reduced cost and power consumption compared to previous generations. This architecture introduces six transformative technologies, including a custom manufacturing process and enhanced networking capabilities, promising breakthroughs across various advanced computing domains. Blackwell will be available through cloud providers and third-party server manufacturers, enabling a new era of large-scale AI deployment.

articles.title: NVIDIA Blackwell Platform Arrives to Power a New Era of Computing
articles.summary: NVIDIA has announced the Blackwell platform, a new GPU architecture designed to power the next generation of AI and accelerated computing. The Blackwell platform promises to enable real-time generative AI on trillion-parameter models with significantly reduced cost and energy consumption compared to its predecessor. Major cloud providers and AI companies, including Amazon Web Services, Google, Meta, Microsoft, OpenAI, Oracle, Tesla, and xAI, are expected to adopt Blackwell.

articles.title: TSMC and Synopsys Bring Breakthrough NVIDIA Computational Lithography Platform to Production
articles.summary: NVIDIA announced that TSMC and Synopsys are using NVIDIA's cuLitho computational lithography platform in production to accelerate semiconductor manufacturing and enable new generative AI algorithms. This collaboration significantly speeds up compute-intensive lithography workloads, reducing production time and costs while pushing the boundaries for advanced chip scaling, including support for NVIDIA's Blackwell architecture. The integration of cuLitho and new generative AI algorithms enhances efficiency and precision in chip fabrication, addressing bottlenecks in the development of next-generation technologies.

articles.title: NVIDIA Announces Project GR00T Foundation Model for Humanoid Robots and Major Isaac Robotics Platform Update
articles.summary: NVIDIA has announced Project GR00T, a general-purpose foundation model for humanoid robots, along with significant updates to its Isaac robotics platform. This initiative includes a new Jetson Thor computer designed for humanoid robots and enhancements to the Isaac platform with generative AI foundation models and simulation tools. Robots powered by GR00T will be capable of understanding natural language and learning skills by observing human actions, marking a major step towards artificial general robotics.

articles.title: SAP and NVIDIA to Accelerate Generative AI Adoption Across Enterprise Applications Powering Global Industries
articles.summary: SAP and NVIDIA announced a partnership to accelerate the adoption of generative AI across SAP’s cloud solutions and applications. The collaboration focuses on building SAP Business AI, including scalable, business-specific generative AI capabilities within SAP's Joule copilot and across its cloud portfolio, leveraging NVIDIA's generative AI foundry services and new NIM microservices. This initiative aims to help customers harness their business data to deploy customized large language models and enhance various enterprise processes.

articles.title: These Bad Habits Hold Investors Back From Peak Performance
articles.summary: This article discusses how common investor bad habits, such as poorly timed buying and selling decisions driven by emotion and excessive activity, lead to underperformance compared to funds. It highlights the "behavior gap" and advises investors to focus on good habits and long-term goals rather than reacting to short-term market noise, political turbulence, or fear of missing out on high-performing stocks.

articles.title: Aclara joins Nvidia and Utilidata in bringing AI to the smart meter
articles.summary: Aclara Technologies has partnered with Utilidata and Nvidia to embed AI modules directly into smart meters, marking the first hardware collaboration for Utilidata's Nvidia-powered distributed AI platform, Karman. This initiative aims to provide utilities with real-time grid insights and significantly more processing power than traditional solutions, accelerating the adoption of AI-driven applications at scale. The partnership expands on earlier efforts to bring AI into smart meters and addresses the need to replace aging meters across the U.S.

articles.title: Democratic ETF outpaces Republican peer on Big Tech bets
articles.summary: An exchange-traded fund tracking Democratic lawmakers' stock trades has significantly outperformed a Republican-oriented fund since its launch last year, driven by strategic investments in megacap technology companies like Nvidia and Microsoft. The Democratic ETF, called NANC, has surged nearly 35%, benefiting from its tilt towards growth stocks, while the Republican ETF, KRUZ, which favors energy and value stocks, gained 18.1%. This performance gap highlights the differing investment strategies based on political affiliations and coincides with growing scrutiny over congressional stock trading.

articles.title: What’s Inside Direxion’s Daily Semiconductor Bull and Bear 3x shares?
articles.summary: This article describes the Direxion Daily Semiconductor Bull (SOXL) and Bear 3X Shares (SOXS) ETFs. It explains that these funds aim for daily investment results of 300%, or 300% of the inverse, of the performance of the NYSE Semiconductor Index, while cautioning that investment objectives are not guaranteed. The article also provides a link for more information about Direxion.

articles.title: AMD CEO Lisa Su Talks the Invisible Role of A.I. Chips in Oscar-Winning Films
articles.summary: AMD CEO Lisa Su highlighted the significant role of A.I. chips in the production of Oscar-winning animated films at SXSW, noting how they drastically accelerate rendering times. She explained that AMD's hardware is used by partners like Pixar and Wētā FX, enabling sophisticated visual effects that were previously far more time-consuming. The executive VFX producer David Conley also emphasized the critical partnership with companies like AMD for the future of filmmaking, especially with the integration of real-time processing and A.I.

articles.title: Dell Stock Has Tripled on AI Hopes. Is It a Buy or a Sell?
articles.summary: Dell's stock has surged over 200% on optimism surrounding its AI server sales, but Morningstar analyst William Kerwin believes the potential benefit to Dell's bottom line is overhyped. Kerwin has a fair value estimate of $55 for Dell, considering the stock significantly overvalued at its current trading price of around $110. He points out that Dell's core businesses are commoditized and that AI servers represent a small portion of its overall sales, with high costs impacting margins.

articles.title: The Next Big Theme: March 2024
articles.summary: This article highlights key trends and developments across several transformative themes in March 2024, including advancements in humanoid robotics, continued growth in electric vehicle sales despite headwinds, breakthroughs in generative AI for audio and video, the scaling up of the global hydrogen industry, and AI-driven innovation in telemedicine and digital health. It also addresses the intensification of ransomware attacks and fortifying cybersecurity defenses. The article concludes by presenting performance and sales growth expectations for these themes, referencing corresponding ETFs.

articles.title: Cadence Reality Digital Twin platform to transform data center design for the AI era
articles.summary: Cadence Design Systems, Inc. has launched the Cadence Reality Digital Twin Platform, an AI-driven solution for sustainable data center design and modernization. This platform aims to improve energy efficiency by up to 30 percent through AI, HPC, and physics-based simulation, addressing issues of stranded capacity and the environmental impact of AI workloads. Industry leaders like Kao Data and Vertiv are praising its ability to optimize operations and prepare for future AI demands.

articles.title: ServiceNow injects more generative AI capabilities into its workflow platform
articles.summary: ServiceNow announced its new Washington D.C. release, integrating enhanced generative AI capabilities across its workflow platform. Key improvements include Now Assist for IT Operations Management AIOps for quicker issue resolution, and updates to the Virtual Agent feature with dynamic translation. The company also introduced Impact AI Accelerators and partnered with Nvidia to simplify and accelerate AI deployment.

articles.title: Why Is Jim Simons Betting Big on Meta?
articles.summary: Jim Simons' Renaissance Technologies significantly increased its Meta [META] holdings in Q4 2023, purchasing over 2 million shares, making it a major investor in the company. This move reflects a broader bullish stance on the tech sector, with the firm also increasing stakes in Uber and Nvidia, while Meta pivots its focus towards AI and returns capital to shareholders. The article notes Meta's strong stock performance, driven by AI hype, and suggests ETFs for investors seeking exposure to Meta within the AI theme.

articles.title: ServiceNow Named a Leader in Customer Service Solutions by Independent Research Firm
articles.summary: ServiceNow (NYSE: NOW) has been named a Leader in the Forrester Wave™: Customer Service Solutions, Q1 2024 for its Customer Service Management (CSM) solution. The recognition highlights ServiceNow's unique focus on "resolution-centric customer service" and its vision to improve customer experience and costs through intelligent self-service and assisted service solutions. The company's AI-powered platform with a single data model is noted for enabling seamless orchestration of customer workflows across various departments.

articles.title: Navitas unveils plans for 8–10kW power platform supporting 2025 AI power requirements
articles.summary: Navitas Semiconductor is developing an 8–10kW power platform to meet the exponential power demands of AI data centers by 2025. This new platform, leveraging advanced GaN and SiC technologies, builds on their earlier 3.2kW and 4.5kW offerings, aiming for higher power density and efficiency. The company anticipates a full platform launch in Q4 2024, addressing the critical power challenge posed by rapidly advancing AI processors.

articles.title: Seeking a Growth ETF with Strong Returns? Check Out ILCG
articles.summary: The iShares Morningstar Growth ETF (ILCG) is highlighted as a strong option for investors seeking growth, offering diversified exposure to 389 top U.S. large- and mid-cap growth stocks. The article emphasizes its long track record of strong returns, low expense ratio of 0.04%, and consistent double-digit annualized returns since its inception in 2004. Despite slightly underperforming the S&P 500 over three years, ILCG has outperformed it over five and ten-year periods, making it a reliable, cost-effective long-term investment.

articles.title: 3 ETFs That Could Turn Your Portfolio Into a Tech Powerhouse
articles.summary: This article recommends three ETFs to create a diversified tech portfolio, moving beyond reliance on "Magnificent 7" mega-caps. It highlights the iShares U.S. Medical Devices ETF (IHI) for healthcare tech, the SPDR Portfolio S&P 600 Small Cap ETF (SPSM) for overlooked small-cap tech, and the iShares Global Tech ETF (IXN) for international exposure. The author emphasizes diversification to mitigate risks associated with concentrated tech holdings and inflated valuations.

articles.title: NVIDIA DRIVE Powers Next Generation of Transportation — From Cars and Trucks to Robotaxis and Autonomous Delivery Vehicles
articles.summary: NVIDIA announced that major transportation companies are adopting its DRIVE Thor centralized car computer for next-generation consumer and commercial vehicles, including EVs, trucks, and robotaxis. DRIVE Thor, featuring the new Blackwell architecture for generative AI, will power advanced autonomous driving and AI-enabled functionalities. Companies like BYD, Hyper, XPENG, Nuro, Plus, Waabi, and WeRide are integrating the platform into their future vehicle roadmaps.
